Html:
Hi radioman,

will there soon be a new stable release of gmap.net including the fixes for the GSat tile problem?

Thank you!
Jockel

Hello radioman,

hmm, realy thought this was talked about serveral times?
It´s not my homelanguage and I am not a programmer, I may
have misunderstood that talking.

The problem:
Using the "Demo.WindowsForms.exe", select Google Satellite, zoom to
entire world, You do not see any satellite-map tiles, Stay in the
Northafrica/Europe region and zoom in more. Some satellite map tiles
appear, many dont. As you zoom in more, more area gets visible.
One of the real bad spots, see screenshot "2".

I thought this probblem was mentioned several times?
Am I wrong?

Best regards
Jockel


Links showing what I was talking about:
http://data.d63500.de/gsat-tiles-radioman.jpg
http://data.d63500.de/gsat-tiles-radioman_2.jpg
works perfectly for me, but if you 'overbrowse' google simply limit your access to their servers for a while, thats why we have a local cache

Hi radioman,

r> works perfectly for me, but if you 'overbrowse' google simply limit your
r> access to their servers for a while, thats why we have a local cache
r> Read the full discussion online.
You think about me having done to much browsing (downloading) maps?
No, I do not think that this is the point, I have just installed the ap on a
PC that has never seen any Google-maps or Gearth application before,
the machine is located some hundred km away from my place, different public-IP.
The behaviour when browsing GoogleSatellite on first opening of the application
is exactly the same! (running XP-SP3, fully patched, dotnet 3.51 installed).

Regards
Jockel

Hello radioman,

r> what version? Try HotBuild
I was using version 1.5.3.3, which is offered as the regular download.

I tried the hotbuild, but the download did not seem to include an
executable "Demo.WindowsForms.exe" and as a "DAU" I am unable to compile
something like thhat myself. But maybe I was overlooking something,
I will redo the download of the hotbuild!

Hi Radiomann,

as I said, I might have overlooked something. Redid it using this ... hmmm .. little bit strange installer thing.
And, bingo, the hotbuild does not show the problem as indicated! So I repost the question, will there be
version based on this hotbuild as your regular version soon, so one can download?

Radioman, thhank you for looking into that!

Regards

Jockel
HotBuild is just a one of the latest changeset - 4487be750c91, you can download any version from the very begining, two years of commit history, use latest
